data.title: Have a way to find which plugin is causing problems.
data.body:
Enter key doesn't work in editor after upgrading to 0.190, and I found it's the "refactor" package. Sometimes it hasn't been this easy, esp with performance problems.

I suggest to add a way to temporally disable packages below a line in the package list, to move it "git bisect" style until the cause is found. I don't want to click many "disable" buttons, having to remember later which ones I already had disabled.

data.title: Project.getRepositoryForPath(path)?
data.body:
Should the Project API, now that it can return multiple repositories (#3691), have a convenience function to return the repository for a given path?

Use case is https://github.com/diiq/atomatigit/issues/75, which needs to figure out which repo to target based on current tab.

data.title: Update help message to reflect changes to multi-path handling
data.body: /cc @atom/core - could you double check my wording of this message?

data.title: Atom-0.190.0 won't start
data.body: Hi, in response to issue #6296 I updatd to atom 0.190.0, which however, will not launch. How can I debug this?

data.title: Atom freezes when clicking web links in settings tab without the web browser already open
data.body:
Atom 0.190.0
Linux.

This happens both in normal, safe and --one mode; it seems to happen only when the browser (I use firefox) is not open yet.

Steps to reproduce: packages > [a package] > settings > view on atom; or release notes > view on atom. If the browser was already open, everything works fine; otherwise, the browser opens but Atom freezes and must be killed from task manager.

data.title: Installing apm......   <===== it seems to be frozen been like that for over an hour now
data.body:
gregory@gregory-UX303LA:~$ npm -v
2.7.5
gregory@gregory-UX303LA:~$ cd atom
gregory@gregory-UX303LA:~/atom$ script/build
Node: v0.10.25
npm: v2.7.5
Installing build modules...
Installing apm....

Something tells me this isn't the first time this has happened. I don't know if it is normal. There is nothing there telling me that there is anything happening at all even the curser has stoped flickering.
Can anybody tell me whats happening? Does anybody know what the nest step is from here?
I'm ok to sit and wait I can put a movie on or do some reading on atom but would like to know if this is going ok.

data.title: Blocking file system access
data.body: I'm using atom editor to edit files on remote file systems using sshfs and i deal with frequent hangs and crashes of atom due to network performance - I suspect it happens due to synchronous file system calls. Would it be possible to introduce some improvements to that( asynchronous calls or something?) ? I can try contributing if anyone thinks it is possible.

data.title: Building fails on Arch Linux (AUR package atom-editor)
data.body:
I'm trying to build Atom on arch linux ([this package](https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/atom-editor/)), and I'm getting an error because of a missing "node" executable. This is the full build output:

```
==> Making package: atom-editor 0.190.0-1 (Thu Apr  9 03:15:22 CEST 2015)
==> Checking runtime dependencies...
==> Checking buildtime dependencies...
==> Retrieving sources...
  -> Found v0.190.0.tar.gz
  -> Found atom-python.patch
==> Validating source files with sha256sums...
    v0.190.0.tar.gz ... Passed
    atom-python.patch ... Passed
==> Extracting sources...
  -> Extracting v0.190.0.tar.gz with bsdtar
==> Starting prepare()...
patching file atom.sh
==> Removing existing $pkgdir/ directory...
==> Starting build()...
Node: v0.12.2
npm: v2.5.1
Installing build modules...
Installing apm...
/home/jonas/atom-editor/src/atom-0.190.0/apm/node_modules/atom-package-manager/bin/apm: line 40: /home/jonas/atom-editor/src/atom-0.190.0/apm/node_modules/atom-package-manager/bin/node: No such file or directory
==> ERROR: A failure occurred in build().
    Aborting...
```

I searched my pacman logs and found that between the last build and now nodejs was updated from 0.12.2-1 to 0.12.2-2. The previously built version was 0.189.0, and there I didn't have this problem. Due to the only nodejs change from the last successful build being pkgrel, I guess it's not a problem with that, but maybe it is interesting.

data.title: Add asar support in Atom
data.body:
Reverts atom/atom#6242 and brings back #5382 
### Packages To Test

These packages use a buffered process which might have issues inside an `.asar` archive.
- [x] Symbols View
- [x] Notifications
- [x] Package Generator
- [x] Settings View
- [x] Tree View
- [x] Update Package Dependencies
- [x] `apm` populating the compile cache on package install
### Platforms To Test
- [x] Windows
  - Verify atom and apm commands work with installer
  - Verify no long paths
- [x] Mac
  - Verify atom and apm commands install from system menu
- [x] Linux
  - Verify atom and apm commands work from native package installation
### Results
- Startup appears 100-200ms faster on my Windows 8.1 VM running inside Parallels
- Windows installer appears to be much snappier

data.title: X Window System error when dragging image file from Firefox/Web over Atom
data.body:
Atom crashes immediately upon dragging (not dropping) an image file from a Firefox/Gnome's Web browser over the Atom editor window.

OS: `Linux arch 3.19.3-1-ARCH x86_64 GNU/Linux`

Atom: `0.190.0`

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open Atom from the command line: `atom --safe --sync -f`
2. Grab an image from Firefox or Web, then drag it over the Atom editor window
3. "Where's Atom?"

Error text:

```
The program 'atom' received an X Window System error.
This probably reflects a bug in the program.
The error was 'BadAtom (invalid Atom parameter)'.
  (Details: serial 1731 error_code 5 request_code 20 minor_code 0)
  (Note to programmers: normally, X errors are reported asynchronously;
   that is, you will receive the error a while after causing it.
   To debug your program, run it with the --sync command line
   option to change this behavior. You can then get a meaningful
   backtrace from your debugger if you break on the gdk_x_error() function.)
```

data.title: Random lockups on Win 8.1 Pro 64bit
data.body:
After build 188 I am getting random lockups on Win 8.1 Pro 64bit.
Editor is not responding (freeze, no CPU use).

On one occasion I just started Atom 190, CTRL-SHIFT-P -> Settings -> Plugins -> Type something into the "Filter packages by name" field (freeze).

None of the builds over the few months have exhibited this behavior ...
188 works fine although I stick with 187 for day to day use because of the "undo" regressions.

I do have a lot of plugins ... Some of which upgrade to newer versions with build 190 ...
What is the best way for me to diagnose this ?

data.title: Character positioning/cursor movement breaks with certain emoji characters
data.body:
Atom 0.190.0, OS X 10.10
Enter some random emoji, such as :ocean::eyes::relieved:, then add :m: to the end, the preceding characters move and overlap and the cursor position gets weird.

![emoji](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1759837/7049599/9f3f513a-de12-11e4-842e-76ea1a04206e.gif)

Seems to only happen with :m:, but I haven't tried everything.

I think it's something to do with variation selectors. When you enter :m: using the OS X emoji palette, it encodes as `e2 93 82 ef b8 8f`, or `CIRCLED LATIN CAPITAL LETTER M` followed by `VARIATION SELECTOR 16`. If you copy and paste just `CIRCLED LATIN CAPITAL LETTER M` it works fine.

data.title: Linux @ VirtualBox mouse problem
data.body:
There is a [known issue](https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=456222) with Chrome41 engine running on Linux in VirtualBox. It actually became a show-stopper for Chrome42. **TL;DR**: in VB Chrome41 engine _always_ runs in touch-screen mode, even on desktops.

Hotfix in Chrome41 is to pass `--touch-devices=123` to the chrome command line.

Is it possible to pass parameters to Atomâs command line so that chrome engine will understand them?

    at atom-workspace.atom.commands.add.core:save-as (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/workspace-element.js:298:30)
    at CommandRegistry.module.exports.CommandRegistry.handleCommandEvent (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/command-registry.js:242:29)
    at CommandRegistry.handleCommandEvent (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/command-registry.js:3:61)
    at CommandRegistry.module.exports.CommandRegistry.dispatch (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/command-registry.js:157:19)
```

```

data.title: atom >= 0.189.0 does not support Chinese input
data.body: Greater than or equal to version 0.189.0 of atom does not support Chinese input.Hopes to fix as soon as possible.

data.title: Inline core menus/keymaps into app package.json
data.body:
We've inlined the bundled package metadata, keymaps, and menus for awhile but neglected the core keymaps and menus.

This pull request inlines all the files in the `keymaps/` and `menus/` folders into the main app's `package.json` file so ~5 fewer JSON files are read and parsed at startup.

I noticed this when I saw `atom.menus.loadPlatformItems` show up in the startup profile since it does a resolve, read, and parse that is directly mirrored in `atom.contextMenu.loadPlatformItems` as well.

data.title: Atom crashing upon "copy"
data.body:
Hi, I recently upgraded to `atom-0.184.0` and the required `atom-shell-0.22.3`. All works remarkably well, considering how severe the one thing that does _not_ is:

Almost always (though strangely enough not really always) atom crashes whenever I try to copy something into its window. Not only that, but even if I have saved a file in a ~5s time window before the crash, it will undo whatever save that was :-/ This is not as far as I can tell contingent on what it is that I copy or where it is copied from.

This is seriously annoying! And sadly I can't seem to debug it , atom automatically detaches itself from the terminal so that I do not see any output...
